articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE, ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON, JILL COLVIN and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump chose Rep. Matt Gaetz of Florida to serve as his attorney general on Wednesday, bypassing more experienced options in favor of a loyalist who has built a national reputation as a disruptor and whom Trump has tasked with dramatically overhauling the Justice Department.
articles.title: Trump picks Matt Gaetz for attorney general, Marco Rubio for secretary of state

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT, LISA MASCARO and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump made a victor’s return to Washington on Wednesday, visiting the White House for a nearly two-hour meeting with President Joe Biden and committing to a straightforward transition of power despite actively working to disrupt the same process four years ago.
articles.title: Trump returns to Washington vowing a smooth transition -- something he didn't ensure four years ago

articles.author: MARY CLARE JALONICK and STEPHEN GROVES
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republicans have elected South Dakota Sen. John Thune as the next Senate majority leader, completing a momentous shift in their leadership that elevates a top deputy of Mitch McConnell into a key position as President-elect Donald Trump returns to the White House.
articles.title: Republican John Thune of South Dakota is elected the next Senate majority leader

articles.author: LISA MASCARO, FARNOUSH AMIRI and KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — House Speaker Mike Johnson won the House Republican nomination Wednesday to stay on the job, on track to keep the gavel after a morning endorsement from President-elect Donald Trump ahead of a full House vote in the new year.
articles.title: Speaker Mike Johnson wins GOP nomination to remain in job, faces full House vote in new year

articles.author: MATT O'BRIEN and TOM KRISHER
articles.description: In picking billionaire Elon Musk to be “our cost cutter” for the U.S. government, President-elect Donald Trump won't be the first American president to empower a business tycoon to look for ways to dramatically cut federal regulations.
articles.title: Elon Musk says he and Trump have 'mandate to delete' regulations. Ethics laws could limit Musk role

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden will hold talks Saturday with China's Xi Jinping on the sidelines of an international summit in Peru, a face-to-face meeting that comes as Beijing braces for Donald Trump's return to the White House.
articles.title: Biden and Xi will meet in Peru as US-China relations tested again by Trump's return

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A man who worked for the U.S. government has been charged with leaking classified information assessing Israel's earlier plans to attack Iran, according to court papers filed Wednesday.
articles.title: US government worker charged with leaking classified documents on Israel's plans to strike Iran

articles.author: TOM NOUVIAN
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Protests erupted in Paris on Wednesday against a controversial gala organized by far-right figures in support of Israel. The event, intended to raise funds for the Israeli military, included Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich among its invited guests.
articles.title: Protests erupt in Paris over pro-Israel gala organized by far-right figures

articles.author: KIRSTEN GRIESHABER
articles.description: BERLIN (AP) — German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said Wednesday that he will ask for a vote of confidence on Dec. 16, paving the way for early parliamentary elections in February.
articles.title: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz says he'll ask for a vote of confidence in December

articles.author: SARAH PARVINI
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Social media site Bluesky has gained 1 million new users in the week since the U.S.
articles.title: Bluesky has added 1 million users since the US election as people seek alternatives to X
